title: Definition of ln
text: ln is a logarithm with base e.
speech: ln is a logarithm with base e.
pacedSpeech: ln is a logarithm with base e.

title: Solving an equation $$lnx=a$$
text: To solve an equation $$lnx=a$$, make both sides exponents of e. $$e^{lnx}=e^a$$, and from the properties of logarithms, since ln has base e, the left side of the $$equation=x$$. Therefore, $$x=e^a$$.
speech: To solve an equation  l n x, is equal to a , make both sides exponents of e. , e raised to the l n x power is equal to, e to the a-th , and from the properties of logarithms, since ln has base e, the left side of the  equation is equal to x . Therefore,  x, is equal to e to the a-th .
